intro: Dalechampia weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
